title: Labour announces ‘Tory tax calculator’ ahead of national insurance cut
description: Story continues Sir Keir Starmer’s party calculates that, as a result, British families will still be £1,200 a year worse off. Shadow Treasury minister Mr Murray said: “After 14 years of economic failure under the Conservatives, working people are ...

title: Every area of Wales would prefer Keir Starmer to be Prime Minister rather than Rishi Sunak
description: Every constituency of Wales would prefer Sir Keir Starmer to be Prime Minister compared to Rishi Sunak, a new poll has shown. The polling, which is a blow to Number 10, shows the Prime Minister isn't the preferred leader in hundreds of constituencies as the year an election is almost certain to be hold starts.

title: SNP conference: Ian Blackford attacks 'Brexit-backing, democracy-denying, Tory-enabling' Labour
description: After the party’s deputy leader Keith Brown led an attack on Sir Keir Starmer’s party overnight, SNP Westminster leader Ian Blackford continued the assault on Labour, who are surging in UK-wide polls amid the economic turmoil caused by the UK Government.

title: Labour announces ‘Tory tax calculator’ ahead of national insurance cut
description: The Opposition party says voters will still be worse off even after the main rate of national insurance is reduced to 10% on January 6.

title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: The Mayor of London presents... As an outstanding act of political onanism this was unparalleled, even by Sadiq Khan's dismal, self-aggrandising standards
description: Khan's vain Vote For Me extravaganza probably cancelled out his extension of the ULEZ zone and gobbled up all the extra revenue it has raised.

title: Labour launches online calculator to track impact of Tory taxes
description: Using the domain ToryTaxCalculator.com, Labour said the online tool would allow voters to select their salary band and find out how much extra tax they may be paying, even after the NI reduction. The calculator will be placed in social media adverts and be targeted at people who search online about their taxes, party officials said.

title: Keir Starmer has been spared the usual angst over Europe
description: There is a terrible paradox for Sir Keir Starmer and all those like him in Labour who opposed Brexit and tried to mitigate its worst effects. It now looks as if, for the first time in half a century

title: The Times view on the prospect of a Labour government: Starmer’s Year
description: With a huge poll lead, Labour will be tempted to play it safe ahead of an election. It would be better if its leader were more explicit about his plans should he win

title: Rishi Sunak insists 'relentless action' to drive down illegal migration is 'working'
description: Sunak said Channel small boat arrivals have fallen year-on-year for the first time since current records began but vowed to "work day and night" to end the problem.

title: Poll: Two-thirds of Brits want General Election by summer
description: A further 16% of people said they wanted a vote in the summer, meaning two-thirds of British voters want an election before the autumn. In total, just 9% said they would want to have the next General Election next autumn, while just 3% opted for next winter.

title: On their marks
description: For both Rishi Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer there is one story that continues to hang over it all and risks fuelling apathy - the small boats crisis

title: The BBC pips celebrate their 100th birthday as we take a look at 1924
description: EXCLUSIVE: From TV to breakfast cereals, air travel and the familiar tones of the wireless, how 1924 set the template for 100 years of progress.

title: The five things Rishi Sunak promised us this time last year as general election looms
description: The prime minister asked us to judge him on how well he delivered his five priorities for 2023 - which is exactly what will happen when Britain goes to the polls

title: Two-thirds of public want Rishi Sunak to call general election by summer, poll shows
description: In a brutal verdict on the Tories' record in office, a majority also believe life has got worse in Britain since 2010, including among more than half of those who voted Conservative in 2019

title: Live: Wales breaking news plus weather and traffic updates (Monday, January 1)
description: Hello, and welcome to Wales Online's live blog for Monday, January 1) We will be bringing you all of the latest news from across Wales - whether you're on the move, at home or at work - as well as the latest traffic and travel.

title: Starmer warns apathy could keep Tories in power in pitch to disillusioned voters
description: Sir Keir will make a plea to disillusioned people urging them to use their vote and warning apathy caused by ineffective politics could keep the Tories in power

title: Labour sets 50% British food pledge to woo farmers
description: Labour has pledged to ensure British produce makes up at least half of food in schools, hospitals and prisons as it set out its “new deal”

title: Labour promises new deal for farmers
description: LABOUR has pledged to ensure British produce makes up at least half of food in schools, hospitals and prisons as it set out its “new deal” for the nation’s farmers. The party said that it would use government buying power to back agricultural businesses as it seeks to woo rural voters before a general election next year.

title: Heroes & Villains of 2023
description: The ruling class has had them in its sights: the Tories are pursuing bans on Palestine solidarity activism at universities, including a ban on the Boycott, Divestment & Sanctions movement, while Stop the War has faced smears and had its meetings banished off-premises at Labour and trade union events for refusing to toe the Nato line on Ukraine.

title: SNP faces biggest challenge in 20 years, says Sturgeon's ex-chief of staff
description: Nicola Sturgeon's former chief of staff has said the SNP faces its biggest challenge in 20 years as it tries "to get its act together". Liz Lloyd said the party "still has some way to go" to convince people it has recovered from Ms Sturgeon's resignation as leader in March 2023.

title: Dave Hill: 2024 – the London year ahead
description: The capital has been recovering from the pandemic, but some of its problems have deepened and urgently need to be addressed

title: The Channel tunnel should have made the UK truly European, but didn’t. We must get back on track
description: As the 30th anniversary approaches, it’s worth remembering the hopes that even Margaret Thatcher shared, says transport specialist Christian Wolmar

title: The election year dawns - and small boats are a key battle line
description: Rishi Sunak himself declared that 2024 will be an election year - at the least discreet location possible: a Christmas party for political journalists. The Conservatives - who were last ahead in the polls more than two years ago - are trying to defy the odds to win a historic fifth term in office in the teeth of a cost-of-living squeeze.

title: Teenage boy stabbed to death in front of hundreds of people before new year celebrations
description: A teenage boy was stabbed to death just minutes before midnight in front of hundreds of people celebrating New Year’s Eve in central London. Harry Pitman, 16, was fatally wounded on the popular Primrose Hill – where crowds gather each year to watch the fireworks across central London – at 11.30pm.

title: Get back on the streets to stand with Palestine
description: The movement for Palestine needs to come roaring back onto the streets—and it needs to go beyond the numbers and the militancy of last year

title: Two-thirds of Brits want General Election by summer, new poll finds
description: A further 16% of people said they wanted a vote in the summer, meaning two-thirds of British voters want an election before the autumn. In total, just 9% said they would want to have the next General Election next autumn, while just 3% opted for next winter.

title: Why Labour needs to decide whether to break the consensus on Israel
description: Airstrikes against Houthi rebels and the prospect of a year-long Gaza conflict will test cross-party thinking at Westminster

title: Michelle Mone and her family say they have been 'treated as a punchbag' after lying about having no connections to a PPE company awarded £200million of government contracts
description: Michelle Mone's husband Doug Barrowman has hit out at what he called 'lamentable failures' by ministers when procuring personal protective equipment during the pandemic.

title: 11 of Rishi Sunak's biggest fights in 2024 from Rwanda battle to more NHS strikes
description: PM Rishi Sunak faces a bruising year as he goes into a general election campaign heading a divided party and trailing Keir Starmer in the polls - with a lot of battles on the way

title: Lady Mone’s husband: We’re being used as punchbags to deflect from government Covid failings
description: The husband of Baroness Mone, the Tory peer, has said his family have been treated as a punchbag for the “lamentable failures” by ministers when procuring personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.

title: Michelle Mone: Doug Barrowman complains of treatment by ministers
description: Disgraced Conservative peer Michelle Mone and her husband have confirmed they are being investigated by the UK's National Crime Agency in

title: From tax cut bonanza to crunch battle on Rwanda, what to expect from Rishi Sunak in 2024 ahead of general election
description: BUCKLE up! If you thought 2023 was one hell of a year for British politics, the next 12 months are going to be even more blockbuster. A looming General Election means the stakes could not be

title: Michelle Mone's husband says family 'treated as punchbag' over PPE row
description: Doug Barrowman has issued a scathing statement in which he says the family have "received death threats and a constant torrent of online and other abuse" as a result of the covid row.

title: Fox 'hunted to ground' in a badger sett by Warwickshire Hunt, claim saboteurs
description: A fox was 'hunted to ground' in a badger sett at the Warwickshire Hunt's Boxing Day meet, claim saboteurs who have released video of the incident. Warwickshire Hunt, which hosted its annual event on the Upton Estate, said it would not add to previous comment about the West Midlands Hunt Saboteurs’ (WMHS) ‘edited and unsubstantiated videos’.

title: Mone’s husband says family ‘treated as punchbag’ in PPE row
description: Doug Barrowman, who led the consortium PPE Medpro, also claimed the Department of Health had shown ‘lamentable failures’ when procuring supplies.

title: New year: Fireworks and street parties ring in 2024 across UK
description: The UK marked the beginning of 2024 with fireworks, street parties and a message of inclusivity as people celebrated across Britain. As Big Ben struck midnight drones lit up the London sky with the message "London, a place for everyone", before a vibrant firework display began.

title: Fox 'hunted to ground' in a badger sett near Banbury, saboteurs release film - hunt thanks cheering supporters at Boxing Day meet
description: A fox was 'hunted to ground' in a badger sett at Shenington, near Banbury on Boxing Day, claim saboteurs who have released video of the incident.

title: Are you ready for seismic change in 2024?
description: More than half of the world will go to the polls this year – and the results could be as stark and startling as they are destabilising. Here’s how to brace yourself, says Ryan Coogan

title: In Pictures: Another turbulent 12 months in UK politics
description: Rishi Sunak is still standing after his first full year as Prime Minister but things have been far from plain sailing for the
